about.name: Adam Seeley
about.title: Junior Software Developer
about.description: Experienced with web development, software development, and data engineering.
details: My name is Adam Seeley. I was born in Arizona and later moved to Utah where I would spend most of my childhood.
Growing up, I had an interest and aptitude for mathematics, reading, and sports.
After graduating high school, I had the opportunity to serve a religious mission for the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints.

education.degree: Bachelor of Science in Management Information Systems
relevantCoursework: Data Pipelines: Implemented ETL pipelines using Pandas for data integration across databases and data sources.
Data Warehousing: Created and interacted with data warehouses and databases using Snowflake, Airbyte, and Docker.
Advanced Python Programming: Engineered complex algorithms for real-world applications, enhancing coding skills.

achievements: Enhanced and debugged over 20 web pages, contributing to the resolution of 40+ issues in PHP and JavaScript.
Developed code that streamlined the job submittal process for HR by consolidating 4 steps into a single process.
Updated reports to use real-time data from ongoing projects company wide.

projects.title: Cryptocurrency Arbitrage Trader
projects.description: Designed algorithms to optimize buying and selling strategies across cryptocurrencies using Python and AWS.

projects.title: Interactive NFL Statistics Website
projects.description: Developed an interactive site to analyze NFL data, using PHP, JavaScript, and MySQL.

volunteer.organization: Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints
activities: Taught English in classes of 20-150 students 3 times a week.
Achieved proficiency in a foreign language through classroom learning and conversations with native speakers.
Worked 70+ hours a week through service, teaching, and helping communities.
